description: From New Latin hypochondrium, from Ancient Greek ὑποχόνδριον (hupokhóndrion, “the soft part of the body below the cartilage and above the navel”), from ὑπό (hupó, “below”) + χόνδρος (khóndros, “cartilage”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The upper region of the abdomen, below the lower ribs, each side of the epigastrium.
